issue.subject: Support of global geographic restriction per user/role
issue.description:
Today, a defined policy declares given restrictions, i.e. scales, bbox,etc... for a list of user/role.

If the administrator manages many different configurations in which he defined the geographic restriction, he has to redefine the geographic restriction for each new policy. But often, for a given user, the geographic restriction is the same (ex.: for a commune).

A nice functionnality to add would be to be able to define a "default geographic restriction" for each user and then give the possibility to assign this default restriction to given policies. 

To discuss... may be not so clear...

journals.notes:
It appears that this evolution is not straighforward with current architecture. To fullfil the demand, policies and rights should be stored in a relational database. It implies major changes in the actual PROXY.

We will propose things in the next months regarding this issue.
